name: Elastic Search
description: Elasticsearch is a powerful open source search and analytics engine that makes data easy to explore.

name: github job template
description: github maven job template used to work with different type of github project
templateData:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>
<maven2-moduleset plugin="maven-plugin@2.15.1">
    <actions/>
    <description></description>
    <keepDependencies>false</keepDependencies>
    <properties>
        <com.sonyericsson.rebuild.RebuildSettings plugin="rebuild@1.25">
            <autoRebuild>false</autoRebuild>
            <rebuildDisabled>false</rebuildDisabled>
        </com.sonyericsson.rebuild.RebuildSettings>
    </properties>
    <scm class="hudson.plugins.git.GitSCM" plugin="git@3.2.0">
        <configVersion>2</configVersion>
        <userRemoteConfigs>
            <hudson.plugins.git.UserRemoteConfig>
                <url>{{github_url}}</url>
            </hudson.plugins.git.UserRemoteConfig>
        </userRemoteConfigs>
        <branches>
            <hudson.plugins.git.BranchSpec>
                <name>*/master</name>
            </hudson.plugins.git.BranchSpec>
        </branches>
        <doGenerateSubmoduleConfigurations>false</doGenerateSubmoduleConfigurations>
        <submoduleCfg class="list"/>
        <extensions/>
    </scm>
    <canRoam>true</canRoam>
    <disabled>false</disabled>
    <blockBuildWhenDownstreamBuilding>false</blockBuildWhenDownstreamBuilding>
    <blockBuildWhenUpstreamBuilding>false</blockBuildWhenUpstreamBuilding>
    <triggers/>
    <concurrentBuild>false</concurrentBuild>
    <rootModule>
        <groupId>org.apache.slider</groupId>
        <artifactId>slider-test</artifactId>
    </rootModule>
    <aggregatorStyleBuild>true</aggregatorStyleBuild>
    <incrementalBuild>false</incrementalBuild>
    <ignoreUpstremChanges>false</ignoreUpstremChanges>
    <ignoreUnsuccessfulUpstreams>false</ignoreUnsuccessfulUpstreams>
    <archivingDisabled>false</archivingDisabled>
    <siteArchivingDisabled>false</siteArchivingDisabled>
    <fingerprintingDisabled>false</fingerprintingDisabled>
    <resolveDependencies>false</resolveDependencies>
    <processPlugins>false</processPlugins>
    <mavenValidationLevel>-1</mavenValidationLevel>
    <runHeadless>false</runHeadless>
    <disableTriggerDownstreamProjects>false</disableTriggerDownstreamProjects>
    <blockTriggerWhenBuilding>true</blockTriggerWhenBuilding>
    <settings class="jenkins.mvn.DefaultSettingsProvider"/>
    <globalSettings class="jenkins.mvn.DefaultGlobalSettingsProvider"/>
    <reporters/>
    <publishers>
        <hudson.tasks.ArtifactArchiver>
            <artifacts>target/**/*</artifacts>
            <allowEmptyArchive>false</allowEmptyArchive>
            <onlyIfSuccessful>false</onlyIfSuccessful>
            <fingerprint>false</fingerprint>
            <defaultExcludes>true</defaultExcludes>
            <caseSensitive>true</caseSensitive>
        </hudson.tasks.ArtifactArchiver>
       
           
    </publishers>
    <buildWrappers/>
    <prebuilders/>
    <postbuilders/>
    <runPostStepsIfResult>
        <name>FAILURE</name>
        <ordinal>2</ordinal>
        <color>RED</color>
        <completeBuild>true</completeBuild>
    </runPostStepsIfResult>
</maven2-moduleset>

article:
STACKS :

Get Stacks :

Get Stacks allows users to retrieve all Stacks in the application with their all details.

We have a full guide on how to get Stacks, let's just use some basic sample code, so you can see how it works.


var request = require("request");
var apiurl = 'http://devcloud.stackdc.io:3005/api/catalog-stacks'
var options = {
method: 'GET',
url: apiurl,
headers:
{
authorization: 'eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJ1c2VybmFtZSI6InZhaWJoYXYiLCJvcmdJZCI6IjU5NTlhN
2JlN2E0MmMyMDBjZGNmMzViOCIsInVzZXJJZCI6IjU5NTlhN2NhN2E0MmMyMDBjZGNmMzkzOSIsInRlbmFudElkIjoiNTk1OWU0ZDg
5NDU0M2UyNDFmYjU5MzNhIiwiaWF0IjoxNTAyODU3NDAyLCJleHAiOjE1MDI4ODYyMDJ9.Cwv7zJ3Y0HXNLTGABuZth_AddXhPmTnx
nYZ771eVuCPeRayAMK0DBv0jXEEQgoOCfiFAd2DcXsnjkPSl6QTmb8bFFcHnmtvwoCzCeZUZxSp6u4jsJcevtr9X5x7dp3ll_kM56n
TvxlXzAPHF0NSjyqoAGftUtdG5wQDElGwYjxLS05h_VmwOTqamJcc-Vy2XyGjFL0TgOj_TMGGYqe9sqxcOBblJH1dkHTeKbnPg-E3I
kz6xj2WkPjYOOxGTsYIZclNufIY8pybEOkd0AxiyvJWh3OfKThOf_3p83meg_4SKQdauQvbIL6bzluNXlH9497gyMy_XUdY3H-Kxmw
uGGA'
}
};
request(options, function (error, response, body) {
if (error) throw new Error(error);
console.log(body);
});


In the above sample code with the help of get call with(/catalog-stacks) route user can retrive all the stacks ,if the get call passed successfully then the user will get response with the stacks objects as shown in the below response code.


[

{
"_id": "5995915d96651c004b1ff118",
"name": "catalogZeroStack1",
"description": "catalogZeroStack description",
"type": "Instance",
"stackId": "5995915d96651c004b1ff118",
"tenant": "5959a7be7a42c200cdcf35b8",
"namespace": "stackaero.catalog.stack.catalogzerostack1",
"created": "2017-08-17T12:51:41.784Z",
"isActive": true,
"createdBy": "srinivas.kanuparthi",
"containers": [],
"instances": [],
"parameters": [],
"status": "Published",
"__v": 0
},
{
"_id": "59911aab65f26a005cd5c471",
"name": "centos-Stack",
"description": "The official build of CentOS.",
"stackId": "59911aab65f26a005cd5c471",
"tenant": "5959a7be7a42c200cdcf35b8",
"namespace": "stackaero.catalog.stack.centos-stack",
"created": "2017-08-14T03:36:11.212Z",
"isActive": true,
"createdBy": "sai",
"containers": [
{
"containerId": {
"_id": "59911a8365f26a005cd5c463",
"name": "centos 7",
"description": "The official build of CentOS.",
"command": "docker pull centos",
"imagePath": "centos",
"readMe": "<h6> <a href=\"ftp://ftp.redhat.com/pub/redhat/linux/enterprise/\" style=\"box-sizing: inherit; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); color: rgb(34, 184, 235); line-height: inherit; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Roboto, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;\">Red Hat</a><span style=\"color: rgb(85, 85, 85); font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Roboto, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;\"> for Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL). As such, CentOS Linux aims to be functionally compatible with RHEL. The CentOS Project mainly changes packages to remove upstream vendor branding and artwork. CentOS Linux is no-cost and free to redistribute. Each CentOS Linux version is maintained for up to 10 years (by means of security updates -- the duration of the support interval by Red Hat has varied over time with respect to Sources released). A new CentOS Linux version is released approximately every 2 years and each CentOS Linux version is periodically updated (roughly every 6 months) to support newer hardware. This results in a secure, low-maintenance, reliable, predictable, and reproducible Linux environment.</span><br></h6><h2 style=\"box-sizing: inherit; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Roboto, Arial, sans-serif; margin: 0.2rem 0px 0.5rem; padding: 0px; color: rgb(20, 118, 152); line-height: 1.4; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; font-size: 2.3125rem;\">Rolling builds</h2><h6><p style=\"box-sizing: inherit; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Roboto, Arial, sans-serif; margin-bottom: 1.25rem; padding: 0px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 16px; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; color: rgb(85, 85, 85);\">The CentOS Project offers regularly updated images for all active releases. These images will be updated monthly or as needed for emergency fixes. These rolling updates are tagged with the major version number only. For example: <code style=\"box-sizing: inherit; font-family: Consolas, "Liberation Mono", Courier, monospace; font-size: 1em; background-color: rgb(248, 248, 248); border-color: rgb(223, 223, 223); border-style: solid; border-width: 0px; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); padding: 0.125rem 0.3125rem 0.0625rem;\">docker pull centos:6</code> or <code style=\"box-sizing: inherit; font-family: Consolas, "Liberation Mono", Courier, monospace; font-size: 1em; background-color: rgb(248, 248, 248); border-color: rgb(223, 223, 223); border-style: solid; border-width: 0px; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); padding: 0.125rem 0.3125rem 0.0625rem;\">docker pull centos:7</code></p></h6><h2 style=\"box-sizing: inherit; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Roboto, Arial, sans-serif; margin: 0.2rem 0px 0.5rem; padding: 0px; color: rgb(20, 118, 152); line-height: 1.4; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; font-size: 2.3125rem;\">Minor tags</h2><h6><p style=\"box-sizing: inherit; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Roboto, Arial, sans-serif; margin-bottom: 1.25rem; padding: 0px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 16px; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; color: rgb(85, 85, 85);\">Additionally, images with minor version tags that correspond to install media are also offered. <span style=\"box-sizing: inherit; font-weight: 700; line-height: inherit;\">These images DO NOT recieve updates</span> as they are intended to match installation iso contents. If you choose to use these images it is highly recommended that you include <code style=\"box-sizing: inherit; font-family: Consolas, "Liberation Mono", Courier, monospace; font-size: 1em; background-color: rgb(248, 248, 248); border-color: rgb(223, 223, 223); border-style: solid; border-width: 0px; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); padding: 0.125rem 0.3125rem 0.0625rem;\">RUN yum -y update && yum clean all</code> in your Dockerfile, or otherwise address any potential security concerns. To use these images, please specify the minor version tag:</p><p style=\"box-sizing: inherit; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Roboto, Arial, sans-serif; margin-bottom: 1.25rem; padding: 0px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 16px; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; color: rgb(85, 85, 85);\">For example: <code style=\"box-sizing: inherit; font-family: Consolas, "Liberation Mono", Courier, monospace; font-size: 1em; background-color: rgb(248, 248, 248); border-color: rgb(223, 223, 223); border-style: solid; border-width: 0px; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); padding: 0.125rem 0.3125rem 0.0625rem;\">docker pull centos:5.11</code> or <code style=\"box-sizing: inherit; font-family: Consolas, "Liberation Mono", Courier, monospace; font-size: 1em; background-color: rgb(248, 248, 248); border-color: rgb(223, 223, 223); border-style: solid; border-width: 0px; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); padding: 0.125rem 0.3125rem 0.0625rem;\">docker pull centos:6.6</code></p></h6><h2 style=\"box-sizing: inherit; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Roboto, Arial, sans-serif; margin: 0.2rem 0px 0.5rem; padding: 0px; color: rgb(20, 118, 152); line-height: 1.4; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; font-size: 2.3125rem;\">Overlayfs and yum</h2><h6><p style=\"box-sizing: inherit; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Roboto, Arial, sans-serif; margin-bottom: 1.25rem; padding: 0px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 16px; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; color: rgb(85, 85, 85);\">Recent Docker versions support the <a href=\"https://docs.docker.com/engine/userguide/storagedriver/overlayfs-driver/\" style=\"box-sizing: inherit; color: rgb(34, 184, 235); line-height: inherit;\">overlayfs</a> backend, which is enabled by default on most distros supporting it from Docker 1.13 onwards. On Centos 6 and 7, <span style=\"box-sizing: inherit; font-weight: 700; line-height: inherit;\">that backend requires yum-plugin-ovl to be installed and enabled</span>; while it is installed by default in recent centos images, make it sure you retain the <code style=\"box-sizing: inherit; font-family: Consolas, "Liberation Mono", Courier, monospace; font-size: 1em; background-color: rgb(248, 248, 248); border-color: rgb(223, 223, 223); border-style: solid; border-width: 0px; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); padding: 0.125rem 0.3125rem 0.0625rem;\">plugins=1</code>option in <code style=\"box-sizing: inherit; font-family: Consolas, "Liberation Mono", Courier, monospace; font-size: 1em; background-color: rgb(248, 248, 248); border-color: rgb(223, 223, 223); border-style: solid; border-width: 0px; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); padding: 0.125rem 0.3125rem 0.0625rem;\">/etc/yum.conf</code> if you update that file; otherwise, you may encounter errors related to rpmdb checksum failure - see <a href=\"https://github.com/docker/docker/issues/10180\" style=\"box-sizing: inherit; color: rgb(34, 184, 235); line-height: inherit;\">Docker ticket 10180</a> for more details.</p><br></h6>",
"containerId": "59911a8365f26a005cd5c463",
"tenant": "5959a7be7a42c200cdcf35b8",
"namespace": "stackaero.catalog.container.centos",
"created": "2017-08-14T03:35:31.704Z",
"isActive": true,
"createdBy": "sai",
"optional": [
{
"label": "user",
"value": "bhargavi",
"_id": "59911a8365f26a005cd5c465"
}
],
"volumes": [],
"links": [],
"ports": [],
"environmentVariables": [],
"parameters": [],
"status": "Published",
"__v": 0,
"modifiedBy": "sai",
"modifiedAt": "2017-08-14T03:39:17.653Z"
},
"containerName": "CentOsResource",
"minQuantity": 1,
"maxQuantity": 1,
"description": "The official build of CentOS.",
"_id": "59911aab65f26a005cd5c473"
}
],
"instances": [],
"parameters": [],
"status": "Published",
"__v": 0
}

]


Create Stacks :

Create Stacks allows users to create new Stack to your application with their basic Stack details.

We have a full guide on how to create Stack, let's just use some basic sample code, so you can see how it works.


var request = require("request");
var apiurl = 'http://devcloud.stackdc.io:3005/api/catalog-stacks';
var options = {
method: 'POST',
url: apiurl,
headers:
{
'content-type': 'application/json',
authorization: 'eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJ1c2VybmFtZSI6InNyaW5pdmFzLmthbnVwYXJ0aGkiLCJ1c2
VySWQiOiI1OTVmMTYzY2IzYWY2MTQ3ZjA4MmEwOTgiLCJ0ZW5hbnRJZCI6IjU5NTlhN2JlN2E0MmMyMDBjZGNmMzViOCIsImlhdCI6M
TUwMjk0MjY2MCwiZXhwIjoxNTAyOTcxNDYwfQ.m61Mt14B2dC0feMWZIn7N1E2urr6oFJWnhUrWJ8CbqlgG8qAtLaFyYjQ6nYE_9Ezz
vPWskZYxUie_JK1m1xw-O8oHMwvshsTDSmmCSQugGJaZr-PLnWvWTxSI02k__lYT2WoJ7LN45_zZdAdvcJl54FNuDhrWIBnOeEqtUbq
KUO7nahpAWpV6p-iYo-iuTVuWGAqiUq4ODOO8toP2_gxQb0cvSvSmJZjTZGayDPlKbxeRMTb-fXef7SXwXI_Ny6fhxKJ9mIiqO4qkp2
iQ1ric9Xqo7b7478Zj_lXiDFQgMnI-SQuWRxH7MlGSgK3Kofb8p1gXZft5rO5_xC0v5qKPw'
},
body:
{
name: 'catalogZeroStack1',
description: 'catalogZeroStack description',
type: 'Instance'
},
json: true
};

request(options, function (error, response, body) {
if (error) throw new Error(error);

console.log(body);
});


In the above sample code with the basic details of stack the stack will be created,if the stack is created successfully then the user will get response with the stack object as shown in the below response code.


{ "__v": 0, "name": "catalogZeroStack1", "description": "catalogZeroStack description", "type": "Instance", "stackId": "5995915d96651c004b1ff118", "tenant": "5959a7be7a42c200cdcf35b8", "namespace": "stackaero.catalog.stack.catalogzerostack1", "_id": "5995915d96651c004b1ff118", "created": "2017-08-17T12:51:41.784Z", "isActive": true, "createdBy": "srinivas.kanuparthi", "containers": [], "instances": [], "parameters": [], "status": "Published" }


Read the Create Stack guide to learn exactly what is happening here, but when you try to create a Stack with existed Stack details then you will get error code(409) with the message of "duplicated values".
